body:
Thanks for the feedback! If your issue is related to the Flutter framework itself,
please open an issue at
[github.com/flutter/flutter](https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/new).

## Steps to Reproduce

I cannot see chrome as device in idea, I am on Gentoo Linux
I can run by issue flutter run -d chrome command
I have this envar:
`CHROME_EXECUTABLE=/usr/bin/google-chrome-stable`

When I refresh devices in idea I see these log messages:
```
^[[6~^[[B2021-10-01 10:01:01,389 [49238278]   INFO - lutter.run.daemon.DeviceDaemon - shutting down Flutter device daemon #3: /data/proj/private/flutter/bin/flutter daemon 
2021-10-01 10:01:05,487 [49242376]   INFO - lutter.run.daemon.DeviceDaemon - starting Flutter device daemon #4: /data/proj/private/flutter/bin/flutter daemon 
2021-10-01 10:01:06,312 [49243201]   INFO - o.flutter.run.daemon.DaemonApi - [<-- [{"event":"daemon.connected","params":{"version":"0.6.1","pid":26465}}]] 
2021-10-01 10:01:06,313 [49243202]   INFO - o.flutter.run.daemon.DaemonApi - [--> {"method":"device.enable","id":0}] 
2021-10-01 10:01:06,340 [49243229]   INFO - o.flutter.run.daemon.DaemonApi - [<-- [{"event":"daemon.logMessage","params":{"level":"status","message":"Starting device daemon..."}}]] 
2021-10-01 10:01:06,340 [49243229]   INFO - lutter.run.daemon.DeviceDaemon - flutter device daemon #4: Starting device daemon... 
2021-10-01 10:01:06,356 [49243245]   INFO - o.flutter.run.daemon.DaemonApi - [<-- [{"id":0}]] 
2021-10-01 10:01:10,368 [49247257]   INFO - o.flutter.run.daemon.DaemonApi - [<-- [{"event":"device.added","params":{"id":"linux","name":"Linux","platform":"linux-x64","emulator":false,"category":"desktop","platformType":"linux","ephemeral":false,"emulatorId":null}}]] 
```


## Version info
```

[âœ“] Flutter (Channel master, 2.6.0-12.0.pre.167, on Gentoo/Linux 5.13.10-gentoo-x86_64, locale en_US.utf8)

    â€¢ All Android licenses accepted.

[âœ“] Chrome - develop for the web
```

comment_data.body:
You may just need to refresh again -- it is sometimes flakey, and we have a goal of rewriting that code, but have not had time to do it yet.

This is a dup of #5550

@stevemessick 
I don't think this issue is resolved and believe it should be re-opened. I am experiencing the exact same results, flutter related lines in the idea.log only report back the "Linux" device when refreshing. I am however able to see Android Emulators and connected devices and they do work fine so far.
The only thing I am missing is Flutter Web. My configuration is similar to the one posted by @archenroot with one exception: I am not using Google Chrome but Chromium - not sure if this makes a difference here (it detects and runs fine on CLI).

**Refreshing does not help, no matter how often I try**

### `flutter devices`
```
2 connected devices:

Linux (desktop) â€¢ linux  â€¢ linux-x64      â€¢ Arch Linux 5.19.2-arch1-1
Chrome (web)    â€¢ chrome â€¢ web-javascript â€¢ Chromium 104.0.5112.101 Arch Linux
```

### Relevant lines from `flutter doctor -v`:
```
[âœ“] Chrome - develop for the web
    â€¢ CHROME_EXECUTABLE = /usr/bin/chromium
```

### `idea.log` (after hitting the device refresh button)
```
2022-08-19 13:18:13,504 [  54300]   INFO - #i.f.r.d.DeviceDaemon - starting Flutter device daemon #2: /opt/flutter/bin/flutter daemon
2022-08-19 13:18:14,337 [  55133]   INFO - #i.f.r.d.DaemonApi - [<-- [{"event":"daemon.connected","params":{"version":"0.6.1","pid":18998}}]]
2022-08-19 13:18:14,338 [  55134]   INFO - #i.f.r.d.DaemonApi - [--> {"method":"device.enable","id":0}]
2022-08-19 13:18:14,355 [  55151]   INFO - #i.f.r.d.DaemonApi - [<-- [{"event":"daemon.logMessage","params":{"level":"status","message":"Starting device daemon..."}}]]
2022-08-19 13:18:14,355 [  55151]   INFO - #i.f.r.d.DeviceDaemon - flutter device daemon #2: Starting device daemon...
2022-08-19 13:18:14,370 [  55166]   INFO - #i.f.r.d.DaemonApi - [<-- [{"id":0}]]
2022-08-19 13:18:16,107 [  56903]   WARN - #c.a.t.i.a.AvdManagerConnection - No Android SDK Found
2022-08-19 13:18:16,107 [  56903]   WARN - #c.a.t.i.a.AvdManagerConnection - No Android SDK Found
2022-08-19 13:18:16,108 [  56904]   WARN - #c.a.t.i.a.AvdManagerConnection - No Android SDK Found
2022-08-19 13:18:16,109 [  56905]   WARN - #c.a.t.i.a.AvdManagerConnection - No Android SDK Found
2022-08-19 13:18:16,109 [  56905]   WARN - #c.a.t.i.a.AvdManagerConnection - No Android SDK Found
2022-08-19 13:18:16,110 [  56906]   WARN - #c.a.t.i.a.AvdManagerConnection - No Android SDK Found
2022-08-19 13:18:16,111 [  56907]   WARN - #c.a.t.i.a.AvdManagerConnection - No Android SDK Found
2022-08-19 13:18:18,386 [  59182]   INFO - #i.f.r.d.DaemonApi - [<-- [{"event":"device.added","params":{"id":"linux","name":"Linux","platform":"linux-x64","emulator":false,"category":"desktop","platformType":"linux","ephemeral":false,"emulatorId":null,"sdk":"Arch Linux 5.19.2-arch1-1","capabilities":{"hotReload":true,"hotRestart":true,"screenshot":false,"fastStart":false,"flutterExit":true,"hardwareRendering":true,"startPaused":true}}}]]
```
(It's complaining a lot about the missing Android SDK. I think these lines can be ignored, everything is working fine in regards with Android)

title: Chrome not available as device
